website_summaries.verdict: Men rave about these shoes for providing boot-like features in a comfortable below-ankle fit suited for occasional tough trail hiking.
pros: Features such as the waterproof leather build, mesh interior, and grippy rubber soles make these KEENs ideal for hiking on rugged trails and slippery surfaces
cons: Men who have owned these before complain that the fit is more snug and narrow than it used to be

customer_reviews.title: I'm very sad to leave such a poor review
customer_reviews.text: I'm very sad to leave such a poor review. I owned a pair of these before these ones for 14 months with every day usage. So much so that the soles wore in on my big toes. My feet are wider than a average person and Keens have been the only shoe that has been truly comfortable. These shoes have great for arch support as well. I've owned this pair for 3 months with every day usage and part of the treads are separating from the bottom of the shoe. Something that really shouldn't be happening on a $100 shoe. I'm probably just going to super glue it back on. Maybe I got a lemon?
customer_reviews.author: S Adams.

customer_reviews.title: Sole separation after several months, serious quality control issues.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in Keen - they used to me my go-to shoe for pretty much everything. Less than 6 months with this pair and the soles started falling off, not just peeling around the edges, but complete separation - the photo was taken at around the 7-8 month point, at which point I just couldn't use them anymore. I used them to go to the office and the occasional trail walk but nothing serious. My previous pair is worn but still going strong as a work shoe. No idea what happened to this company, but I'm not going to risk buying their products again.
customer_reviews.author: dianhouzi

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like the good ole Keens.
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved Keens. I had the same pair for 5 years and wore them every weekday. However, the Targhee II is awful. I wore them a few days around town and the strap on the shoe snapped. Maybe I got a defective pair, but after reading the same thing in other reviews, clearly Keen has slipped in quality. Quite a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Chase S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair, always the same shoe, recommended by my podiatrist. I take out the liners and put in my orthotics. I have learned to buy expensive shoes because they are so much better for my feet and the shoe lasts a lot longer than cheaper shoes so in actuality there is not much difference in price. Very good shoe with a lot of good features; comfortable, water resistant, don't loosen up easily like cheap shoes, easy on and off without retying.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Blomquist

customer_reviews.title: These were great shoes for a while
customer_reviews.text: These were great shoes for a while, but after a few months the left one started to squeak with every step. It's not the insole, nor the squeak of rubber on the floor - it appears that the glue holding the sole together has begun to fail and separate, and the noise comes from the outer layer of the sole rubbing against the next layer when the shoe flexes. Searching the web for 'keen squeak' turns up tons of complaints, so this isn't an isolated incident. I believe the quality if Keen's workmanship and/or materials has decreased lately - this will likely be my last purchase from them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Henney

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised and are miss sized
customer_reviews.text: One star due to 1. Not true to size at all. I ordered a size 12 felt like I was trying on a size 11. 2. False advertising, On the description it states made in USA, These shoes are made in Thailand My recommendation is for Keen to go to their Thailand manufacturer and get the sizing fixed. Also update there description that the shoe is imported, I pride myself to try to by products in that are made in the USA to support the American workers. I don't support Companies that falsely advertise their products. Results I turned this item back immediately for the for mentioned reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Norway

customer_reviews.title: Quality over gimmicks
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I bought, the first pair I bought 3 years ago daily worn I put an average of 6 miles a day ! Very comfortable they are designed for the shape of feet not for “ cool looking ( like nike and other brands) “. About 2 years in I had to glue rubber end of tread back down which is nothing compared to others not even lasting 2 years ( use shoe goop or e6000 )
customer_reviews.author: Davee

customer_reviews.title: One of the burned
customer_reviews.text: I took the leap after reading the negative reviews and I too got burned. I ordered my size but they are to big. My heel slides up and down I tied them tight as they would allow and I leave them tied they are slip ons, I just slip them on and off while tied. Mine were made in Taiwan I really needed a good shoe for work but I'm afraid this was a costly mistake
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Second pair of Keens all good.
customer_reviews.text: First pair was a pretty decent pair of shoes given the garbage market we’re in today. I wouldn’t say that they were the best pair I’ve ever owned but I’m also pretty hard on my shoes. I’m a big guy and when I find a pair I wear them all day every day until they wear out. This pair fits true and appears well made. The last pair started separating at the toe cap and the leather got too soft to hold its shape any more. I think these are gonna do the same, but I got a good six months to a year out of the last pair. We’ll see if these hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Ain't got no sole
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of Keen shoes in the past and have been pleased. These shoes however are far from the quality of those in the past. I wear these shoes daily, but they are worn under what would considered 'light usage'. I walk around the house, the office and on the sidewalk. A few months after owning these, a chunk of the sole fell off of one shoe. Since that time, 1 inch pieces of the sole are peeling off in at least 3 other places. Sorry, but a shoe just isn't a shoe without the sole. These Keen shoes are definitely not worth the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: IDreviewer

customer_reviews.title: TOE BOX CHANGED - KEEN Men's Targhee II Hiking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I came here to replace a pair of Men's Targhee II Hiking Shoes I bought in 2016 by hitting "Buy It Again". Shocked to discover that the toe box felt a lot more snug than my old pair. Checked the size, yep, 11 medium. Model Targhee II, check. Thought maybe they needed to be broken in. Took a short walk. A half mile out I realized I was experiencing some serious pain in both big toes. Turned around and gingerly walked back home. The toe box was so tight that it jammed my (well trimmed) toe nails into the cuticle, causing them to bleed. You've lost your edge, Keen, and a customer. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: R Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Toe Box Top Not Tall Enough - rubs toes!
customer_reviews.text: I've had another pair of these shoes for several years and loved them. They have been used hard and decided wanted a new pair. Shoes ordered are the right size and long enough for my feet. What you see in photo is how the top of the toe box rubbed the top edge of my big toe on both feet! Impossible to wear and I'll be returning. Realized my older pair had a steel toe and that gives it more height in the shoe box! I may see if I can find a pair with steel toe and try them out for size.
customer_reviews.author: JEB

customer_reviews.title: a little clunkier than the Exp
customer_reviews.text: The same design that works well for the Targhee II boot is a bit too clunky in a lower shoe. It not only looks clumsy, but doesn't seem to fit as well without the ankle part of the boot, slipping on my heel while walking. It's likely I could have tightened down the laces extra (after breaking the shoe in) and worn heavier socks, but overall it didn't feel like it was working. I ended up returning these shoes, and going with the slightly cheaper, narrower Targhee Exp hiking shoe instead. That gives up leather for synthetic, but both the fit and appearance are better.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Siddique

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced but comfy
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like the insoles so I replaced with gel ones. They are very comfortable now. For the money I am not impressed with the construction. The glue job on the sole is messy and doesnt look real solid so I am not surprised people have them coming apart on them. I havent worn mine a ton but they are holding up. These would be great if they were about 50 bucks max. They have too many issues as you can see from reviews to warrant their current cost.
customer_reviews.author: toolness1

customer_reviews.title: Huge Quality Drop
customer_reviews.text: Got a pait in 2014, lasted 3 years of every day work wear. Got a new pair in June of 17. After 8 months had sole delamination like everyone else. Definite quality drop on what was a fantastic shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Stu George

customer_reviews.title: Durability in question
customer_reviews.text: Quality appears to be going down hill. 1st pair lasted 5 yrs - till sole started crumbling - just worn out. This pair, sole coming apart at 1 yr old. (see pic - both shoes coming apart in same spots, in arches, on both sides of shoes - worst shown) Plenty of tread left - WTF! Shoes well cared for, not worn every day. Average worn a week a month. Worn in rain occasionally, but never waded through a stream or lake. Disappointed after previous experience with Keen boots. Buyers beware. Rated 2 stars because other than this obvious defect, shoes seem to be holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs small. I wear an 11 and had to get a 12. 11 1/2.was a little tight. It was worth the trouble. I'm on my feet a lot. Easily the most comfortable shoe I've ever owned. From the looks of the construction. I expect this shoe to last a long time. *edit 6/22/20.afyer 8 months the heel started separating from the shoe. I filed a warranty claim with keen which they approved. I was not seeking full value since I got 8 months heavy usage. Nevertheless keen gave me full credit towards new pair. Outstanding! Keen customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: What is wrong???
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what gives here... I've been wearing Keens almost exclusively for 15 yrs. I love them! My feet usually are super happy. This pair feels wrong. Seem to run smaller (I ALWAYS wear size 11) than typical Keens. And odly the left shoe pronates. Are these true Keens???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were used before I received them. I have worn Keen for the last 10 years and always thought their fit was perfect. This pair were a huge disappointment. The toe box is too wide and the entire shoe feels too big. Even wearing two pairs of socks, the shoe feels too large.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt S.

customer_reviews.title: They are not exactly like the Targhee II Low Hiker shoe I bought last year.
customer_reviews.text: They run a about a half size small. I knew that and forgot. I reordered size 13 and they were too big. The main reason was that the heel height was lower by about 3/8 to 1/2". That allowed the shoe to ride up and down on my heel. Very uncomfortable. Meanwhile I wear the Low Hiker's every day. It's pretty much the only shoe I do wear, it's that comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Schulze

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased last summer as was looking for a good day hike shoe. Have worn approximately 4x's and no where near the comfort of any Ecco shoes boots I have owned. They run small and have been relegated to the closet. I purchased at a reasonable price but will be sticking with Ecco's and will not purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle1

customer_reviews.title: Tell your feet how you really feel about them.
customer_reviews.text: Do you hate your feet? Like you REALLY want to punish them, then these shoes are for you. Do you want all the rigidity of a hiking boot sole with NONE of the ankle support? Then these shoes are for you. If you want something comfortable to hike in... get anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Fit was great for my husbands wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Fit was great for my husbands wide feet, comfy... Biggest disappointment that within a week of wearing them casually (not every day), the tread is starting to peel off on the outside towards the toes where the feet bend. I had higher expectations? When my husband showed me, his brother asks "are those keens?" And we told him yes. He said his were falling apart at the tread also, he has had his pair for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best in the Business!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Keen shoes that I wear on a daily basis because I am outdoors every day and on my feet for long hours. Whenever it rains my yard doesn't drain well and is typically muddy or sloppy or wet in some areas for long periods of time after it rains, but my feet stay dry because of the waterproofing on these shoes! They are a rugged, yet comfortable shoe to wear no matter what you might come across and no matter the length of time you wear them! They have my vote!
customer_reviews.author: mudbug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. He has a treadmill desk at work and walks 10 - 20 miles a day so the cheaper walking shoes that I had been buying him could not hold up and ended up hurting his feet. I suggested he try the Keens after I bought him a pair of Keen boots (that he loved) for our vacation. He loves these shoes. They feel good on his wide feet and make walking all day enjoyable. Hopefully they will last longer that his old shoes since they are a little expensive but I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie P.

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied that I had to submit warranty claim after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of use webbing to hold shoe lace is coming apart on tongue of one shoe. I submitted a warranty claim online and the next day they provided me a credit to order another pair of shoes off their web site. I'm still frustrated and feel Keen's quality isn't what it has been previously but they did make this right since the shoes weren in the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: TXAmazonCust

customer_reviews.title: Broken Lace guide
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2nd pair of Keens and for the most part they performed very well. The problem I had was that about a year after I had them one if the lace guides ripped! I have never had this problem on any shoe I have ever had, especially a shoe that cost around $100. This is not the quality I have come to expect from Keen. The bad thing is that these shoes still have a lot of life left in them but I can't wear them because it won't lace properly. I have attached pictures for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Jmsanfo

customer_reviews.title: Hiking or Daily?
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are my daily pair. But I use them for day-hikes and weeklong backpacking too. They are very comfortable. They seemed "biggish" when I first put them on, but they settled right in to being a perfect shoe. The only reason for 4-stars, is they don't seem to have lasted as long as my last pair. My previous ones wore out the soles before pieces and parts started coming unglued. This pair seems to doing the opposite. Though this is about the time I normally replace them, so maybe I'm being a little too critical! These are about 1-year old and ~800 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: I love them, but...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really like these shoes. I keep buying a new pair, because these are really comfortable and mostly durable, except for one thing. The cloth loop eyelets are the biggest weakness in these shoes. These are my everyday shoes, since I work in a warehouse environment, and the whole thing holds together really well, except the eyelets. On a good pair, the eyelets will last 9 months before one cuts through, but most have started going by the 6 month mark. If we could get some reinforcement, like what is used on other styles, to make the eyelets more durable, these would be the best
customer_reviews.author: Brian Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Try on and wear quickly so they can be sent back if they do not fit.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Keen's Targhee shoes for years. I always had to order 1/2 size larger. It even stated that on the Keen website. I looked and it does not now. I wear an 8 1/2 and ordered these in a 9. These are to big. However, I previously ordered the KEEN Utility Men's PTC Dress Oxford Work Shoe in an 8 1/2 and the bottom inside eye on both feet hurt quite a bit. They went back. I guess my next pair will be purchased in a store where I can try them on.
customer_reviews.author: Function First

customer_reviews.title: 3rd pair and still love them
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 pairs of these shoes. I like them because they have good support and the soles don't break down with my heavy weight. They are relatively rugged, however they always fail the same way. There is are thin peaces of the sole that wrap around the sides of the shoe that always tear off. It is a poor design feature, however I still like the shoe enough that I keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: mr97

customer_reviews.title: I thought about sending these shoes back for the first 2 weeks because they do have a very slight slip but its nothing that will bother you whatsoever now after six months or so of daily wearing these shoes and in harsh conditions I can easily say these shoes are fast becoming my all-time favorite ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay so for many years I have bought Merrell shoes never had a pair of Keens. I thought about sending these shoes back for the first 2 weeks because they do have a very slight slip but its nothing that will bother you whatsoever now after six months or so of daily wearing these shoes and in harsh conditions I can easily say these shoes are fast becoming my all-time favorite shoes extremely comfortable extremely durable very waterproof really love these shoes will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L.

customer_reviews.title: Not the Same Keen!
customer_reviews.text: So sad to write a bad review - but these shoes got smaller and way more expensive! I have hit the "reorder" button for the last 3 pair for my husband. This time, they're smaller and the price was jacked up. They went from $87 to $125 for the exact same pair within 9 months. I returned them and will go to the store to purchase a pair that fit. Someone mentioned most of these are made in china now. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Defect causes heel pain!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband and they arrived in time and fit him well. He has been wearing this shoe for years. Unfortunately, after a few weeks of wearing the new Targhee II he developed heel pain in his right heel. He tried inserts to support and other suitable stretches and therapy for his heel. After trying for a week, he finally gave up and starting using another pair of shoes...PAIN GONE! We think these shoes may have a defect.
customer_reviews.author: G. McGuffin

customer_reviews.title: quality built, too small
customer_reviews.text: i have worn size 12 shoes for over 30 years, this is the first size 12 i've bought that i can't make work with my feet. it's just too short, my toes are all the way to the end to the point that it hurts to walk any prolonged distance. that really sucks because the shoe is great, it's built like a tank and i'm sure it would last a long time but this particular pair is useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: bitterguy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Shoe, but Not Much Ankle Support
customer_reviews.text: I returned these after trying them on. Because they are a shoe and not a boot there is very little ankle support even after pulling the laces very tight. I also noticed that they were larger than all the other shoes I purchase in the same size. Quality was excellent, but I purchased a different boot from Columbia for half the price and was very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these boots
customer_reviews.text: Well made boots and after a week of wearing them everyday they have broken in perfectly. This is my 3rd set of Keen boots, but the first time I purchased the low profile hikers. I use them as my work boots and after a day of working on a construction site, my feet feel great at the end of the day. I would recommend Keen boots 100% and will purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hanks

customer_reviews.title: Flap of loose material inside toebox...
customer_reviews.text: So I have put about 25 miles in these shoes allowing for break in. My toes are always weird due to neuropathy so I did not think much of pain in my toes until one day I was cleaning them out when I noticed a flap of folded material inside the toebox at the front of the shoe. Additionally there were some minor imperfections with the stitching (stitches not lining up) which I thought odd. Furthermore there was no care instructions or marketing materials inside the box. So my thought was that these were previously returned and resold to me. Or possibly factory seconds. I tried to go directly to Keen for a solution and have heard nothing back.
customer_reviews.author: Smickey

customer_reviews.title: This high quality solved some of my leg problems
customer_reviews.text: I had Plantar fascias on my left side, and some kind of heel/foot weakness 1 in below ankle at back, ie i had sharp pain on my heals. I play squash and other game. so, got into this heal issues, suffering for 1 year. After i started using this shoe, it reduced and almost healed the weaknesses by distributing the sharp pain into some areas and kind of almost healed the weaknesses.
customer_reviews.author: Prab Balasubramanian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit - Helps with PF
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these same brand style shoes for several years after trying lot of other brands and styles My PF went away and they provide great support of hiking, walking, everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Hartmann

customer_reviews.title: Foot Doctor Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for first time from advise from my foot doctor. I needed some neutral shoes to get fitted with some orthotics this week. I’ll update review after a week or so of wear with orthotics in place. Love the feel of these hikers out of the box and i think wide shoe feels much better than medium. Order a boot and Austins Are next on my list.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Like them. 3rd pair of this brand
customer_reviews.text: I wear 16D this felt a bit loose. That said I really like them. I can wear thick socks & lace tight which is what I should do for hiking anyway. I have been wearing them loose with thin socks for daily wear, I can slip them on & go. They have been comfortable & given good support even wearing them loose. This is my third pair of Keen shoes. So far I easily get 3 years out of them with fairly constant wear & they are slow to show wear Mark's for the first year, not too bad after that.
customer_reviews.author: Memphis Tom

customer_reviews.title: Knee pain
customer_reviews.text: This is my Third pair of Keen’s. First two pairs were amazing. All three are Targhee’s. This pair of shoes is a bust. The Keen Targhee II caused immediate knee pain after one days use. These Keen Targhee’s are unwearable. Also unreturnable as I cleverly tried to transition from my old Keen Targhee’s gradually thus exceeding my one month return window. Since this shoe is identical to the Keen Targhee II shoe I’ve been wearing the past year, I thought it a safe buy. Probably should have bought these shoes locally.
customer_reviews.author: Landrover

customer_reviews.title: I liked Keen Shoes BUT
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've purchased Keen hiking shoes many times. However, my two most recent purchases have shown a sharp decline in the quality which I believe corresponds to their manufacturing being move to China. In my case, the sole of the shoe has been coming apart. This shouldn't be happening to a shoe costing as much as these do and for the purpose (hiking) that they are supposedly made for. I'll probably but this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Walter R. Schoenly

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable, and not made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these, but they just weren't comfortable. The brown leather discolored where the toe box bends the first step I took in them. And it is worth mentioning, when a listing says "Made in the USA or Imported", as this one does, it means you are looking at an imported product. I was willing to pay more for Keen because they are (or at least used to be) made in Oregon. This model is definitely an import.
customer_reviews.author: Camelot One

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I went to the Bass Pro shop and tried on several brands of hiking shoes. My first impression of the Targhee shoes was that they look like old lady orthopedic shoes. When I tried them on, they fit like a glove. I buy men's shoes, because women's shoes are cut differently, and they kill my feet. These shoes are great, and well constructed. I got over the granny look. If you aren't fussy about color, Amazon has a different price for each color. I selected the pair with the lowest price, and it was $50 cheaper than the pair in the store. These will last me forever! I'll be walking pretty when I'm 80!
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe with great traction
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking shoe. Put 10 miles on them this weekend. Very good support for the foot and the traction is very aggressive. I didn’t think much of the waterproof claim being low top shoes but was pleasantly surprised as I walked a trail covered in wet grass and my feet staid dry. I wear a 10.5. The Targhee was too tight so I returned for an 11 and it was perfect. Overall a really good buy and I saved some money during Prime days to boot!
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Keen review
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keens for years now. I started due to heal spurs and I have had no problems since. My only reason for rating 4 stars vs. 5 is that I have found some inconsistency in sizing. I order based on the shoes I am currently wearing and this usually works, but I had to send the last pair back, then reorder at a 1/2 size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the old Keen shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Keen shoes for several years and this is my third pair of the same model. They don't feel the same and the rubber in the sole is harder than past shoes. I can hear every step even on cement. Support feels good. The laces are extremely long and create a very big bow when tied. They could be a full 12 inches shorter and still be long enough. I plan to shop for other shoes the next time I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnydon

customer_reviews.title: They are the BEST!! (normally) I myself have MANY pair
customer_reviews.text: Actually, these fit my husband in the toe, but too big in the heal. This is his second paid. The first was way too tight in the toe but fit everywhere else. So not sure what to say for fitting. I guess it depends on the shoe. You can't beat Keen for Men's or Women's shoes! They are the BEST!! (normally) I myself have MANY pair, boots, shoes, and sandals. Since I have a wide foot and high arch, I go a 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: I am a big fan of Keen hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit of the shoe and my last pair lasted two years for me. I have put in my arch support inserts and my feet are already feeling more comfortable in them. The old pair had started to really show signs of wear in the sole. I bought the exact same shoe as I did in 2017 they have been so comfortable on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent A. DiPaula, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: No different than the regular Targhee II except you pay more for this one
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the Keen Targhee II shoe for years and tried this wide version. I wanted the extra width and high instep since the other is uncomfortable until fully broken in. I paid more for this version and do not notice any difference in the width or instep. I am not sure what the difference is except this one costs $30 more.
customer_reviews.author: KingB

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best in waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Keen. Simply the best in waterproof, comfortable, hiking footwear. We have owned well over thirty pairs of Keen shoes. (Male and female) Personally, we both wear wide shoes. These run wide and suit our needs perfectly. You can walk through puddles or snow and as long as it is not deeper than the tops of your shoes your feet remain dry. Personal note, we live in the south and were looking for a snow boot so requested an insulated Keen boot. A sales rep, told us as long as our feet were dry they would stay warm. We were doubtful, but she was right. Dry in the south equates warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Rambling in Uwharrie

customer_reviews.title: Don't order 1/2 size smaller
customer_reviews.text: Keen boots are a favorite because they have a roomy toe box. the ad said order 1/2 size bigger so I ordered an 11 when I usually order a 10 1/2. The shoe is usable but rather loose. They may be OK in cold weather with heavy wool socks. I live in VT and we do get very cold winters. However I may just exchange them for the right size?
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Broe

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice hiking shoes. Very supportive, and the base is rigid enough that going over rocks, etc doesn't stress your foot as much. Only downside is how the tongue is constructed. It doesn't attach to the outside of the boots at the top, so can be a little uncomfortable if it works itself to one side or the other.
customer_reviews.author: P.R.

customer_reviews.title: be amazed how good these shoes are
customer_reviews.text: After ordering shoes .. Step 1 get shoe box Step 2 open box Step 3 put on shoes Step 4 hike 5 miles day 1 Step 5 hike 11.5 miles day 2 Step 6 be amazed how good these shoes are ~ NO BLISTERS OR HOT SPOTS !!! ( no sock liners either ) Step 7 write Amazon review
customer_reviews.author: C. BARRETT GRAFF

customer_reviews.title: Product AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are AWESOME, second time we are buying the same style. They are worn by a contractor who is on his feel all day. They last the distance. The delivery experience was not-so good, comments say “Your package was left on the back porch”... the package was in fact left in the open air and unsecured 'front' porch, only a few steps away from the pavement, and in real danger of being stolen. Delivery person buzzed ALL THREE residents buzzers and did not wait for a response. Hmmm!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof as advertised, questionable durability
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for 4 months now wearing them daily on residential construction sites. The waterproofing works great. The only defects so far have been part of the tread ripping off and today my shoelace broke at the toe. Overall, not the most durable shoe but comfortable and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Hampton Robinson

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: This is about my 15th pair of Keens of two styles over 20 years. IF you try them on in the store you can be assured of proper fit. Buying the size that fit you in the store for the exact same model and style shoe online is problematic, especially in the toebox area. This pair was a good example of inconsistent sizing and was at least a half size too small.
customer_reviews.author: White Marlin

customer_reviews.title: TOO, TOO HOT & HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Just wore these for the first time today....they appear well made....BUT, man oh man, are they hot, hot, hot and heavy, heavy, heavy - they feel like Dutch clogs, wooden clogs, perhaps even concrete clogs; i sure wouldn't want to wear them on any extended hike.....and hiking is exactly what they're advertised for. Maybe i'll get used to them, but first impression is decidedly negative.
customer_reviews.author: ABee

customer_reviews.title: I'm liking them
customer_reviews.text: Not my first pair of hiking shoes, but I do like these. I've been having problems with my feet and my high end Zamberlans was making it worse. I got these Keens on the advice of a friend and so far so good. I was rolling my ankle quite a bit and these shoes tend to compensate for that. Worth the money and a true fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T.

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: this is my second pair and both have the rubber tread coming unattached from the shoe....do not purchase this shoe irrespective of anything you might read elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Clint N. Paschal

customer_reviews.title: I heard from a friend that he loves his KEEN shoes and that they last for a couple of years of abuse and he recommended I also g
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to wear all day(8-12 hour day) while doing maintenance. I heard from a friend that he loves his KEEN shoes and that they last for a couple of years of abuse and he recommended I also get a pair. I always thought it really did not matter if i bought a $40 pair of shoes or something +$75 there wasn't a real difference in them. BOY, was i totally wrong. These totally blow away every cheap pair of shoes in every way possible that i should have took the leap for a good pair sooner, it would have saved me many aching back days. GREAT SHOES, WORTH EVERY PENNY, TOTALLY RECOMMEND THESES!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of Keen shoes over the years, and liked them a lot. I had a pair KEEN Men's Targhee II Hiking Shoes I liked but were wearing out after a lot or miles. I ordered a new pair of the same size as the old pair I had, and the same size as 4 or 5 other pairs of Keen shoes I have. When I got the new shoes, the left shoe was at least a half size larger than the right shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Turner

customer_reviews.title: I Love Keen Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes. I own about 6 pairs of Keen shoes and they are the most comfortable shoes in my closet. The Targhee is a great hiking shoe that can be worn for any casual event. They are waterproof (tested) and will last longer than you are willing to wear them. I use the old ones for yardwork. American made and high quality. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: KC COLE

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended waterproof hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen shoes and the Targhee II continues the Keen reputation. I can buy my size with confidence without the need to try them on, because the sizing has been consistent from year to year and model to model. The Keen footbed continues to be firm and comfortable, with great support. The Targhee II is waterproof, which is great if you hike into wet environments. The shoes do get a little warmer than non-waterproof shoes, so if you don't need the waterproofing you might opt for a more ventilated shoe. I don't consider myself particularly well-coordinated, but these shoes deliver confidence when I walk/hike, in addition to comfort and waterproofing. Definitely a "highly recommended" from me.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ho

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought Clarks, but once I tried on a pair of Keens shoes, I was sold on their quality and comfort. I then bought Keen sandals and they are also the best on my feet. I love Keen products. Not cheap, but well worth the price. You only pay for quality once.
customer_reviews.author: Amos Moses

customer_reviews.title: Targhee Not As Good As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: These were my second pair of Targhee’s. The first pair were fine with the exception that the sole started to peel off after about 150 miles. Bought another pair since they continue to be so well rated however am having the same problem again and this time my mileage is under 100. After much research am switching to a trail runner shoe...much lighter weight, greater comfort and longer lasting according to reviews.
customer_reviews.author: mg5

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, weird tongue.
customer_reviews.text: These are good shoes with excellent tread, but the arch support is on the opposite side of the foot from the arch and the tongue doesn't really fit right, which makes it feel like my heels are going to escape the shoe with every step. I plan to add an arch support to the shoe because it's a good quality product, but I do wonder how a shoe that fits, which this one does, feels so loose.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Best to try on first.  Mine seemed a bit small.  Not as good as the boots.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Keen hiking boot thought I'd try the shoe. Not the same, size seems a bit small and just not as comfortable and the boots.
customer_reviews.author: R Dan Pauley

customer_reviews.title: What happened???
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keens forever, my old pair wore out, so I ordered a new pair. I am 12.5, so I always order a 13, which for the past ten years has fit just fine. Just got a new pair, could not even get my feet into the shoe! They fit like a size 10 or 11!!!! Something terrible has happened to the company. I saw bad reviews, I just couldn't believe that Keen dropped the ball. What a total disappointment . . .
customer_reviews.author: CGR

customer_reviews.title: Easier to slip on and off
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous version. The laces don’t seem to come up quite as high as the previous pair which is fine w me. I end up trying to untie them when I take them off at first but inevitably start slipping them on and off. It’s the only reason I need to keep getting new pairs - because I end up wearing out the backs. These seem to slip on and off easier without curling the backs. Arches are good which I need but these have a slightly higher outside “arch” which has taken a little getting used to. Overall I like them a lot. Not quite 5 stars but close.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Coletta

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DON’T BUY THESE SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I STARTED WEARING THESE SHOE ON OCTOBER 15, 2018 What I dislike about these shoes, is the fact that the soles are coming apart already with only about a months wear on them. I m very disappointed with the quality of these shoes. I would not recommend these or this brand to anyone. I only gave them one star because I can’t give them a zero.
customer_reviews.author: Lewie, Jr

customer_reviews.title: tighter toebox
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like these low hikers.(12m) I've got a pair of mid hikers (12m(1 yr old) & loved the way they felt from day one)) These are not as generous in the toe box - I can just feel my toes touch although they are comfortable with regular crew socks Knowing that now, I would have gone up a half size (not available) or bought a different brand Lastly, these do not have "bungie" cord laces, therefore they do not just pull on/off
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Something wrong with KEEN sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of pairs of KEEN shoes, size 10. Ordered another pair, size 10. Too large by about an inch or so, impossible to wear. Ordered size 9.5 -- can barely insert my foot in it, toes firmly against front of the shoe. This is very inconsistent sizing (or manufacturing problem). When the size is right, these are some of the most comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Pen_Name

customer_reviews.title: Ouch?
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit as expected from front to back and width-wise, it's the internal height of the shoe that is an issue for me. There seems to be less room which is putting an unusual amount of pressure on the top of my feet when I'm walking, and this is with the factory insoles. I attempted to put prescribed orthotics in and even loosened the laces but it still placed more pressure on the tops of my feet than I'm used to. I've owned and have enjoyed Keen's for years but this model just isn't right for me. Unfortunately once you wear them in your natural habitat, they become nonreturnable.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of hiking shoes I have ever put on
customer_reviews.text: I have worn hiking shoes for 30 plus years. I have purchased many brands ..Usually Merrell is my choice but these are by far some of the best i have every had. The WIDE toe box is awesome. I can walk on fresh dew grass for extended times with my feel never feeling the slightest dampness. I would say some of the best waterproofing I have had in a shoe. Unreal comfort and overall a top notch hiking shoe ..I use them for everyday were there are so comfortable. I recently got a vented pair too!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Walker

customer_reviews.title: They fall apart after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen’s for 10 years. The last 2 the heels and rubber pieces of the soles come apart after 2 months of light use, not even hiking. If your life can depend on your shoes on a hike these aren’t for you. They come apart like the glue is Elmers.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph V. Rome Jr.

customer_reviews.title: My first pair of Keens.  May try again.
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on at a retail store but they didn't have the color I wanted. I figured at least I know what size I need. I ordered these on-line and they were a little larger than in the store. They are too 1/2 size too large but I've grown to live with that. I'm not hiking in them or anything. My feet stay comfortable all day. I take 3-4 mile walks with the dog and my feet are happy. I was surprised to find these shoes are slippery on wet surfaces. The rubber soles seem hard and do not grip like you would think.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Boy

customer_reviews.title: Five bright stars!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn a lot of shoes over the years. A LOT. Hiking, outdoor court, indoor court, running, casual, dress – you name it. Not only are these Keen's the best hiking boot I've ever owned, but they are possibly the best shoes I've owned, period. Keen uses quality materials and clearly assembles the shoes with much care and precision. There are a lot of plusses here, but none better than the wide toe box. It's comfortable when just walking around, but really shines when hiking downhill – the toes don't feel any discomfort or pinching. I bought these for hiking but find myself wearing them whenever I'm out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Mac

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are smaller than the marked size would indicate.
customer_reviews.text: The description on Amazon said that the size was "true to fit" or something to that effect, but that is not the case. I would advise going up a half size. I have not yet used these shoes for a long hike on a hot day, but I can easily imagine them becoming uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Overall Like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't buy shoes online because of sizing variations. These worked out OK, however; I have to use a shoe stretcher to get a better fit. Don't let anyone say they sell shoes "true to size" This is a catch phrase used by retailers to get you to buy.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: defective toe protection unstick seam right on the second day of use
customer_reviews.text: Im very disappointed with this shoes Im a Keen fan since long time ago I bought several pairs of shoes in the past, but the last two pairs looks like their quality is low I only wear this shoes two days and the front plastic toe protector got unstick very easy on the seam looks like they use a cheap glue or something hopefully I can get my refund back otherwise what a waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: but they seem to fit pretty good. My other Keen's that I've had for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them 2 times, but they seem to fit pretty good. My other Keen's that I've had for over 3yrs took several months to break in, but these are doing good right out of the box. A little disappointed that the color wasn't as it appeared when purchased, but it'll be alright. They feel and fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from Tn

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoe almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of the Keen hiking shoes; the larger toe box that is somewhat shaped to your natural foot shape is great. The one downside is the insole; very little support or cushion so I put in an aftermarket insole that provides the heel cushion and the arch support that makes my shoes unique to me.
customer_reviews.author: Papabear

customer_reviews.title: Weird heel
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 pairs of Keen boots and I love them. They are the most comfortable boots I have ever had. I even have a pair of steel toe Keen boots and they are comfortable to wear all day. I really want to like these shoes. They are very comfortable. Great toe box, roomy. The problem I have is that the heel feels loose. Every time I walk it feels like by foot is going to come out of the shoe. Over time, this could cause an issue for me by forming a hot spot or blister. I really wanted these to work because I wanted a shoe version of their Targhee boot.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ski

customer_reviews.title: Feels like the originals!
customer_reviews.text: One of the few if only Keen shoe that fits just like my old ones did from 10 years ago. Width was perfect (I have wide feet) length could be just a tiny bit longer but still comfortable (I wear a size 12 and these are 12's). Build quality seems very good. Shoes laces are just a little short. After trying over 7 different styles of Keen shoes and sending them back to Amazon these are finally the ones my feet give a toes up on!
customer_reviews.author: Sonoran Desert

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes for work and daily wear. He said that they are comfortable with the first wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are trash.
customer_reviews.text: I had these shoes for less than a month. The treads on both of the shoes are falling apart. I would highly recommend NOT to buy these shoes. I work construction and walk on all sorts of surfaces. Most shoes last me about 4-6 months. I can not believe that they did not even make it 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G

customer_reviews.title: however I am just wearing light smart wool socks
customer_reviews.text: 20 minutes in.... I had to replace the first pair because the WP Line was dropping out of the toe. Shoe's were new, but knew it wasn't gonna fly for me. Overnighted a second pair, and am sending the first pair back tomorrow. Hopefully this stays four stars! Sizing, I wear a 10 and ordered a 10... Fits perfectly, however I am just wearing light smart wool socks. Don't plan on wearing anything much heavier as these will be used as a summer work shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Keen Targhee II Sole Separation & Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Keen, specifically the Targhee and Targhee II Hiking shoe for many years with no problems... until the past couple of pairs in which the sole begins to separate from the shoe. Keens return.replacement process is to fill out an online form (so there is no receipt of the claim) and wait 6 weeks. Unfortunately it's easy to forget about the shoes after a few weeks and then months later I had to call Keen customer service to find out that the replacement had been approved. Now it's good that they are replacing the shoes, but I wish their manufacturing process would produce better shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Keen's #1!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the most comfortable, have the best arch support, and fit of any shoes I've owned, right out of the box, This pair replaced the same pair I've had for at least 10 years. Only thing, the laces wore out, so I put the no-tie stretch laces in them. Great stuff! I still wear the old ones in the shop, or work every day. The sole materials may be slightly different on the new ones, as they are slightly stiffer, but 99% the same. Far better than the Merrill's I have, or the Columbia's I just bought. I won't be trying any different ones for a long time to come. Keen's are best!
customer_reviews.author: Jefro

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Keen shoe
customer_reviews.text: While Keen has built a reputation as a rugged outdoor shoe, with many desirable features that hikers, fishermen, etc. all desire, I was very disappointed at the fit and comfort of this model. I don’t know what has changed in their footbed design, but in future I will opt to try other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Silverio

customer_reviews.title: Wow! That good!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality, as durable as some $300-$500 hiking shoes. Very very comfortable and priced at a steal in my opinion. You will never ever find as high of quality at anywhere close to this price. If you need quality hiking shoes and you don’t get these your doing yourself a disservice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Wish the Fit Like the Discontinued Alamosa
customer_reviews.text: I have many pairs of the discontinued Alamosa Keen Men's Hiking shoe and LOVE them. They run a full size short, but their width is excellent in a D for me. I tried this Targhee II in the same size. Length is as consistent with the Alamosa, but the width is greater, especially at the heel. Further, this shoe does not want to permit lacing tightly due to the material used for the laces and lace points. I'm sure this makes them durable, but it's playing heck with trying to get them snug. My only choice seem to be extra pairs of sox.
customer_reviews.author: CPHT

customer_reviews.title: great daily shoes or light hikers
customer_reviews.text: I love my Targhee II's. These are great hiking shoes and seem to be outlasting my previous shoes from another manufacturer by a huge degree. I have a few acres of woods and spend time camping and tromping around out there, and these are great for it. They're comfortable and stylish enough to wear them out and around but waterproof and supportive enough for goofing off in the woods and light hiking. I would probably want the high top version if I were hiking more avidly, though.
customer_reviews.author: zemmiphobe

customer_reviews.title: More hiking shoe than beefed up running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking shoe. I have owned and completely worn out the Keen Bryce and they have discontinued that model. The Targhee's was the closest thing I could find to the Bryce (I wanted waterproof and leather without flashy colors) The Targhee's have a little more bulk and a little more angle or slope from heel to toe so they feel more like a hiking boot than a beefed up running shoe. Great arch support and plenty of toe room.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Not even worn a year and falling apart, sole is coming off. Not what to expect from keens.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I like the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I use spenco's for arch support in all my shoes per advice from a podiatrist. I like the shoes. These are my fourth pair of Keen's. I've been wearing keen low cut with mesh panels the past two summers and will probably replace them when I can find a pair in my size. Generally in the winter I wear Keen water proof mids. I wear keen boots hiking on good trails but for rough terrain and climbing I wear tighter fitting boots, although they are not as comfortable. All and all iIgive keens a five star rating.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this shoe for work. He needs a lot of support and something that is waterproof. This is the only show he will buy for work! He says they are very comfortable and give him the support he needs for being on his feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Targhee II Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description:
Here's a waterproof hiking boot that offers four-wheel-drive performance for your feet. It's designed to keep your feet dry and let them breathe, and the aggressive outsole bites into the terrain. The mid-cut height adds ankle support.Weight:15.4 oz / 436.6 g

From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.
feature_bullets: Waterproof: KEEN.DRY a waterproof, breathable membrane lets vapor out without letting water in; Durable waterproof protection stands up to wet weather, and the lug outsole adds traction
Traction: KEEN ALL-TERRAIN rubber outsole provides high-traction grip in muddy environments and on rocky surfaces; Non-marking rubber outsoles leaves no trace or imprints when walking indoors

Support & Comfort: External stability shank offers lightweight support for improved mobility and torsion control on uneven surfaces; Cushioned collar reduces irritation and discomfort around ankle; Mesh lining helps keep feet cool in warmer environments

Fit & Comfort: This internal support mechanism is anatomically engineered to provide excellent arch support and cradle the original form of the foot; This style runs a 1/2 size small; We suggest ordering a 1/2 size larger than your usual size
Care Tips: To treat day to day wear and tear, especially on lighter color leathers, we recommend using a leather cleaner and conditioner, found at most footwear dealers and/or shoe repair shops
